diagrams.description: Artificial Intelligence evolved from philosophical speculation to transformative technology reshaping society. The concept of intelligent machines appeared in ancient mythology and early automation. Alan Turing proposed the Turing Test (1950) for machine intelligence. The Dartmouth Conference (1956) coined artificial intelligence and launched the field with optimistic predictions. Early AI focused on symbolic reasoning and problem-solving in the 1950s-1960s. The first AI winter (1970s) followed unmet expectations and funding cuts. Expert systems revived AI in the 1980s with commercial success. The second AI winter occurred in late 1980s-early 1990s due to limitations. Machine learning resurgence began in the 1990s with statistical approaches. Deep learning breakthrough came with AlexNet (2012) winning ImageNet competition. AlphaGo defeated world champion (2016) demonstrating reinforcement learning power. Transformer architecture (2017) revolutionized natural language processing. GPT-3 (2020) and ChatGPT (2022) demonstrated large language model capabilities. Today's AI integrates foundation models, multimodal learning, and pursues artificial general intelligence while addressing alignment and safety challenges.
diagrams.mermaid_code:
timeline
    title The History of Artificial Intelligence (AI)
    section The Foundations
        1950 : Alan Turing - The Turing Test
        1956 : Dartmouth Workshop - "Artificial Intelligence" is coined
    section Early Success & The First "AI Winter"
        1950s-70s : Early successes in problem solving & natural language
        1974-1980 : The first "AI Winter" - funding dries up
    section The 1980s: Expert Systems
        1980s : Rise of expert systems
        1987-1993 : The second "AI Winter"
    section The 1990s & 2000s: Machine Learning
        1997 : IBM's Deep Blue beats Garry Kasparov in chess
        2000s : Rise of machine learning, statistical approaches
    section The 2010s: Deep Learning & The AI Boom
        2012 : AlexNet wins ImageNet competition
        2016 : Google's AlphaGo beats Lee Sedol in Go
        2018 : OpenAI's GPT-1 is released
    section The 2020s: Generative AI
        2022 : ChatGPT is released
